title: FOX’s Jacqui Heinrich’s Climb From Overnight Intern To Cable Correspondent
summary:
Host of FOX Business' The Claman Countdown, Liz Claman, is joined by FOX News National Correspondent, Jacqui Heinrich.
FOX's Jacqui Heinrich got her start in news after interning on Capitol Hill, as an intern for Norah O'Donnell on MSNBC.
From working overnights at MSNBC, Jacqui went to KOAA in Colorado Springs, then KTNV-TV in Las Vegas, and then Boston 25 News before coming to New York City to work for the FOX News Channel.
In this conversation, Jacqui and Liz discuss the winding climb that all broadcast journalists face as they advance in their careers.
Jacqui explains the lessons she learned as a novice reporter, her experience covering the 2020 election as a FOX political reporter, and what's ahead for her coverage and her career.
paragraphs: Host of FOX Business' The Claman Countdown, Liz Claman, is joined by FOX News National Correspondent, Jacqui Heinrich.

FOX's Jacqui Heinrich got her start in news after interning on Capitol Hill, as an intern for Norah O'Donnell on MSNBC. From working overnights at MSNBC, Jacqui went to KOAA in Colorado Springs, then KTNV-TV in Las Vegas, and then Boston 25 News before coming to New York City to work for the FOX News Channel.

In this conversation, Jacqui and Liz discuss the winding climb that all broadcast journalists face as they advance in their careers. Jacqui explains the lessons she learned as a novice reporter, her experience covering the 2020 election as a FOX political reporter, and what's ahead for her coverage and her career.
